sentence.text: In this work we investigated the role of forkhead box O1 (cellular response to starvation) in the transcriptional regulation in macrophages, which affects the anti-tumor functions of tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs).
First, we showed that TAMs expressed reduced levels of cellular response to starvation, which was associated with their protumoral M2 polarization state.
The suppression of cellular response to starvation expression in TAM was induced by the hypoxic condition in the tumor microenviroment.
Furthermore, we used cellular response to starvation conditional knockout apoptotic process to show that FoxO1 deficiency in myeloid cells exacerbates tumor growth.

These results demonstrate that the protumoral property of TAMs is induced by the hypoxia-triggered cellular response to starvation deficiency, which could be a potential target of novel anti-tumor therapies
